As a university we place a high value on First Amendment rights to free speech and peaceable assembly PERIOD We encourage civil discussion and engagement in discourse and believe that a wide range of viewpoints strengthens us as a community PERIOD

What we  and the world  saw in Charlottesville Virginia was none of those things PERIOD

We watched people using hatred bigotry and violence to intimidate and terrorize a peaceful community PERIOD I find it deeply disturbing to see fringe groups using a notable university community as a platform for their reprehensible actions PERIOD The result was a senseless loss of life and irreparable damage to innocent people  a tragedy for all PERIOD I extend deepest sympathies to families of those impacted and our colleagues  the faculty staff and students at the University of Virginia  and stand with them in condemning these expressions of prejudice and hate PERIOD We must unite in our support of societys shared values of inclusivity broad acceptance of differences and peaceful exchange of opinions and ideas PERIOD I urge everyone to be a part of this process PERIOD We must not permit these acts of injustice and bigotry to go unchallenged PERIOD

We will continue Penn States commitment to diversity and inclusion and do all that we can together to foster a safe and openminded community PERIOD To help achieve this goal I ask all of you to reach out to people different from yourself listen to new perspectives and embrace your fellow Penn Staters and neighbors PERIOD

Thank you for your support PERIOD
